page.title: 05COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: National and local newspapers are delivered twice daily from{Harmston} P.O., whilst{Coleby's}two deliveries stem from the Navenby newsagent. The daily Echo and the weekly Lincolnshire Chronicle are available, together with 3 freely delivered papers financed by advertising. A monthly church magazine is distributed.There is good reception from national BBC Radio stations and from Radio Lincoln. BBC1, BBC2, ITA Yorkshire and Channel 4 television channels are viewed. Both villages have a small P.O. On weekdays mail is collected twice from the P.O.s and from a{Harmston Hospital}gate postbox. One mail van delivery is made through- out. Each village has a public tele- phone box,but most homes are connected privately. On alternate Tuesdays a mobile library makes one 20 minute stop in{Harmston,}two in{Coleby. }
